intro: Calendula persica var. microcephala, commonly known as the Persian marigold, is a compact, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features vibrant yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive, daisy-like appearance, typically measuring 2–4 inches in diameter. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also have historical uses in herbal medicine and as a natural dye.
